title: 10 things to remember that will make you better at league
body:
1. The Ward giveth, and the Ward taketh away.
2. Before you facecheck that bush, remember that there is a Garen in it.
3. Sometimes, Garen is a benevolent God. Usually, he is not.
4. If I had a dollar for every time a snowballing champion snowballed, I would main Nunu and become rich.
5. The best way to ward the enemy red buff is to place 1 ward in the bush behind red, one ward in the bush across from red, and 1 ward in the bush by Raptors. You'll know that you've done it correctly if the triangle created by the wards and the half circle wall behind red looks something like this:
http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/villains/images/7/78/Illuminati-Logo.png/revision/latest?cb=20150529234113
6. If you think that now is the correct time to Baron, then you're wrong.
7. If you know that now is the correct time to Baron, then you're right.
8. There are only three champions in the game that can flame and consistently win: Brand, Annie, and Shyvanna.
-Amendment: lol, everyone kept coming in correcting me about other champions that use fire. SO apparently now Kayle and Rumble are also Flamers. You're welcome, Kayle mains.
Edit: And Godyr.
9. Thou shalt not covet thy ADC's Farm. {{champion:37}} 
10. The chance that your team mates might remember this in your next match... It fills you with determination!

I played about an hour of undertale.  It was okay.  Does it get better?

Undertale only gets better the more time you spend playing it. the game has tons of hidden details and information in each of it's 3 story lines, not to mention they seem to have different lines of Dialogue based on whether or not you've used your resets.
But if you think the entire game is going to be as easy as the Toriel and Papyrus's sections were, you should be warned: the last parts of the game QUICKLY become a bullet hell.
As a dark souls vet.  I say bring it.
http://i.imgur.com/7GcOo87.gif
and when you get as deep as i do you can only hope for a gaster fight in hardmode.

To add to that, there are lots of things that change based on exactly what you did.  Some things from the beginning of the game can have an impact near the end, and the save file is literally full of flags and counters tracking _everything_.

Also, beware of the man who speaks in hands...
